intro: Ottonia frutescens var. microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf ottonia, is a compact, flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
